description: The worse client I have ever seen! Keeps poping up with login, not connected to outlook. Don't waste your time.
summary: Keeps poping up with login, not connected to outlook

description: Already awesome and yet still manages to get better with every release!
Seemless integration with MS Exchange. Size of emails are in excess of 60Gigs and never had a problem these past 4 years. Well done to the developers.

When I set up CalDAV everything seemed to work fine. Calendar and Adressbook was loaded quickly. From the 2nd startup every connecting to the calendar or addressbook takes an eternity. Makes the tool entirely worthless. Plus there seem to be no logs and there is absolutely no help online - the name of the tool alone makes search harder.
App keeps causing my Ubuntu OS to crash, errors when syncing/ updating emails.

Friendly looking interface, message sending receiving works excellent. Also email signature works well, but there are few remarks to it.

- Remark #1 - When certain signature type is set to be default ( HTML type signature ), message composition should be set automatically to HTML otherwise message will be looking weird ( can be fixed in the preferences though ).

- Remak #2 - When defining signature for specific email account there is no remove signature option ( there is workaround -> a remove option in preferences / composition / signatures ).

I like callendar import and overall design of the application.

Overall i'm satisfied and will give 5 stars since i think this application has a good perspective and a lot of effort is done to make it eye pleasing and intuitive.

I'm finally able to switch from Thunderbird to something better in IMHO.
Gnome Calendar can't add my mailcow calendars. This just works. Funcionality is as good or better than when I used to use this full-time years ago.

Could someone explain why it's deemed necessary to impose all those folders at the bottom left corner (mail, contact, calendar, tasks, memos) with no obvious way to remove them. I have several email accounts & those folders obscure them.

Evolution is still the best free mail client on Linux with support for Exchange and Outlook/Office365.

I'm using Evolution 3.44.1 on Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS for this review.

Our work emails are hosted on outlook.office.com and we recently implemented DUO multifactor authentication. 

Evolution was able to fetch all my mails, notes, tasks, calendar and contacts.

If you can't connect to your Exchange/Outlook server, I suggest changing authentication to either NTLM or OAuth2. And make sure you installed the Exchange Web Services add on.

Works great in my experience.
summary: Works great for my work emails (Office365 + DUO security)

description: I am done with this app!! I am constantly having to whip it outand reinstall because it won't open.
Once you become a heavy user and have chunks of conversations, it crashes when saving images, takes time to load emails and when it crashes, it doesn't save a draft or recover the last email.
Eats a lot of ram
The only thing I need. Right now I'm using an extension to receive mail notifications, but if native support comes and it directly opens the unread mail that will be awesome.
summary: Exellent but need mail notifications when evolution is not running

description: Evolution works great in general. What makes it most valuable to me is support for MS Exchange, including calendar and tasks.

crashes all the time since the new updates, takes 10 MINUTES to start and then hangs when opening a different inbox, when receiving mail, when sending it... used to be OK, but now the developers are doing their best to get former evolution users to just use webmail
summary: new updates make it super unstable, not usable normally anymore

description:
It works well as an Outlook alternative in Linux, but it's missing a lot. Could really use something like Quick Actions from Outlook 2013 and 2016 implemented. My biggest gripe is the brackets that are added to the subject line for a forward. 

e.g. [Fw:Subject]

Really? Evolution appears to be the ONLY mail client that does this and there is no option to turn it off. Searching online finds people complaining about it from the early 00's. How long does it take to fix something this simple?

I am totally happy with the performance and capabilities of this app. I had trouble getting earlier versions to connect with my Exchange server for calendar and contacts. Version 3.31.90-1 works like a charm.
summary: Great app, definitely recommended for Exchange users

description: I love it it has the seting i need and it is siple i use kde neon.
not updating and bad work
Best Alternative for Outlook

I guess some prefer Evolution, I tried it for a while but keep coming back to Thunderbird. 
I find Thunderbird easier to use; one advantage of Thunderbird is that it is very easy to back up all emails as they are stored in a single place (profile) which was not possible with Evolution - I know that Evolution has a backup facility but for some reason this never worked for me.
summary: sorry... but find Thunderbird easier to use

description: do doubt this is the best alternative of Outlook, i tried almost all Linux based clients email but evolution is top of them.
Can't work properly with my google account

Great email app, does everything I need it to and is by far the best/most configurable client I have used in linux as an outlook replacement in a primarily MS enterprise environment.

At time of writing: 3.28.5-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
summary: Works great with MS Office/EWS via OWA

description: I try others but keep coming back. It's straightforward, powerful and best of all it just works.

I've been using this email client on my main home machine for a couple weeks now. I've noticed with my email accounts that are not Gmail, that those accounts sync quickly, but that my Gmail accounts syncs more slowly (also when sending an email). Not a huge issue as I don't have time sensitive home emails. All in all, it works well and is pretty intuitive. I love that it's open source even if it's not as flashy as say MailSpring.

I haven't checked to see if it supports encryption or other such baubles.

Thanks for the great email client!

Developer refuses to acknowledge and take ownership/control of incoming e-mails and apply local machine settings by accepting and displaying settings (i.e. Date) from Senders. Unlike Thunderbird and Outlook and others

Very good email client to use in an enterprise setup. It has all features one could think of.

It works well with Exchange EWS and is a solid replacement for Outlook.
Evolution will get the job done if you are on an old MS Exchange server. For everything else, there are easier-to-use choices such as thunderbird or geary.
Debian 10 is missing the ews package, it's terrible, please.
Very simple to use. Love it.

Great for a while, if a little bloated. Nice layout for mail.

After 9 months of use, it suddenly stopped connecting to all accounts with spinning wheels as it tried. Often followed a sleep/suspend but not always. Forcibly terminating the various processes sometimes allow it to reconnect but not always.
summary: Useful app but inexplicably stopped retrieving mail after sleep

description: Does everything I need it to and is the best client I have used in Linux for an outlook replacement so far; would like to see/look forward to more options, development in the future!

It feels lean and does exactly what I need it to. It doesn't offer a GPG key management tool but since my desktop has that anyway this would be a useless duplication. In my many years experience with Evolution it never let me down and I am grateful for it. Compared to Evolution Thunderbird is very heavy and slow.
summary: Certainly one of the best email clients

description: Very good integration with google contacts and calendar, multiple inboxes are easily handled and configured. Best email client for Linux.
Simple UI. Easy to use.
Setup my account without any type of errors!

i think gmail did something to prevent holding the account within the system does ok with aol and yahoo but will not hold the gmail accounts there is always a connection issue, how ever i used blue mail not i have not had a disconnection like i have on evolution, i said screw it with this i can not count on half and half so I'm seeking alternative replacements.
It just works, has everything you need.
I use it to check emails in my gmail accout. I have set the Evolution to sync the emails in the past 60 days only, but it still freezes my computer 8 of 10 times. Have to uninstall it.

I came from MS Outlook (since its birth), tried a few GNU email clients and found this one to be more visually appealing than Thunderbird (Thunderbird is really outdated), despite both to be OK (functionality wise).
For instance, where it could be improved would be adding the text editing system to 'Text' and 'HTML', e.g. choosing font name, font size, headings, ...

So far it's been getting the job done as a calendar only, have not used it as an email client. Seems a bit busy, I would like a simpler calendar, but Orage and Calendar did not agree with Peppermint 10. Probably operator error. Overall I like it.
Great app for Microsoft account! Definitively more reliable and effectiveness than Thunderbird.
Great app, would recommend

Help, How to get the "Munu Bar" back ? 
After I set the View-->Layout-->Show Menu Bar to disable, I can't find any menu or tool to get back it. help please. 

I give four star for this reason, or else five start
summary: Help needed!! How to get the "Munu Bar" back ?

description: Tell your friends to download it and once they enter all correct information it will keep popping up for your password, over and over and over and over and over and over and it won't even give an error.
summary: If you want to annoy your friends..

description: I have an exchange email through go daddy and a hushmail.com email address and this app will not connect to either. going back to thunderbird.
Best email client, integrates very well with Nextcloud

I'm kinda disappointed in this app. While it's praised everywhere, I removed it after 3 days of usage. The interface lags, freezes, emails are not updated sometimes the icons are strange and the calendar part is unintuitive.
The best e-mail for Gnome.
For some reason, this is the email client I feel most comfortable with. There is enough customization but not too much. Kind of just works. But then again, i don't do any fancy stuff with my email.
Integrates well with gnome account setup. EWS extension is especially useful.

I'm using Debian Buster with GNOME 3.30.

I've been using this mail client since I installed my system. I like it a lot, and it does everything I need it to do (PGP, and integrate with my tasks and and contacts).

There's just one thing that it doesn't have, that I really wish it did, which is an option for a system tray icon. Having to keep the whole client open on another workspace just so I can get mail every hour is a bit annoying to work around.
summary: Really good mail client. Needs system tray icon

description: While playing with the view options I accidentally chose to hide the menu bar and therefore could not get back into the View menu to get it back. Tried looking through the docs and nothing mentioned. Also uninstalled and reinstalled but preferences have remained and therefore I am still unable to access the menu bar.
summary: Accidentally hid the menu bar and could not get it back

description: I am pretty new to my transition to Ubuntu from Windows and have always been a fan of Outlook for managing my multiple email accounts. This client is a great replacement for me. It handles my Gmail account for my University and my personal Outlook account. Handles Google Calendar better than Outlook actually because Microsoft chose to make their software unable to function with Google Calendar.
Don't like the interface
It can connect without issues to my company's exchange server. It has simple UI. Great job!

Evolution as delivered through Ubuntu's S/W app no longer supports Outlook. The version installed via apt-get (sudo apt-get install evolution && sudo apt-get install evolution-ews) offers Outlook support but it does not work. When I use the same account setup information that works in Thunderbird with the Outlook plugin, Evolution will accept that info but never actually loads up email.
summary: Looks good but never loads Outlook Email

description: This is the Linux alternative to MS Outlook with full eXchange integration, not just for email, but including calendar, contacts, tasks and notes. If you like/love linux but works in a MS Outlook based company/environment, this is your client.
summary: excellent MS outlook client with exchange

description: This one has worked flawlessly for me since day one. Easy to set up and use.

Since coming to Linux I have tried several different Personal information clients and I have to say I keep coming back to Evolution. Evolution is very similar in functionality, appearance to Outlook so the learning curve is slight. I have been using Outlook most of my life and that is what is exclusively used by my employer so having something that is similar reduces the stress of going back in forth and having to regularly "shift gears". I love the integration with google mail/contacts/calendar. Everything has moved over flawlessly, save for a some issues with a few of my contacts (that may be a problem with the way I have them on the Google servers but I am not sure yet). I am currently running Linux Fedora 32 with Cinnamon Desktop on an EliteBook 8440w (i7-720M, Nvidia Quatro FX 320M, 8gb Ram, 500GB SSHD) and other than the initial set up and download, the program runs very quickly and can easily switch between sections within the software (Mail, calendar, etc.)

I also have Outlook.com as my other e-mail server and the mail integration is smooth. My only area of concern is that there is no integration of the Outlook.com calendar or contact list yet. I have not had a chance to try other services (Yahoo, juno, etc,) yet so I can not speak to them.

The big takeaway is that Evolution plays well with Google Services and Outlook.com and is is very easy to switch between Outlook, Google Service and Evolution. Well made product, most highly recommend for Linux Users.
bugs open 2014 - no one cares...
I am using Outlook from work but for my private I use Evolution. I miss nothing from MicroSoft Outlook. I mapped all my pst from Outlook. It is the best opensource mail and calendar software
Evolution is a replacement for Outlook with much more features than what outlook has. The only piece of software that made me switch to linux full time.
Clean, elegant lightweight mail client. Brilliant!

I love Evolution, truly do...BUT, the constant failure to connect to gmail accounts and calendars is insane. I'll delete all of the gmail connections and re-add them and it'll work for a while then stop again, constantly asking to authenticate with each calendar and gmail.com accounts. Very frustrating.
My to-do list, contacts and calendars from multiple accounts syncronised right of the bat. Way better than the stock Gnome Calendar app.
Tested on X220 & X61 on Xubuntu 20.04

The app is robust, however quite ugly and obsolete.
I didn't notice any changes since many years ago.
summary: Can't be minimized to system tray

description: Just installed and I will say it is good out of the box. It looks nice and works well. The reason I have only given it 4 stars is because it does not minimize to tray. It did that I would happily give it five out of five stars.
The one program I cannot do without. Simple, straightforward and magnificent.

Evolution is the best application for GNOME users because of its seamless integration with the desktop environment. It is very easy syncing data from online services and whatnot. Evolution is also stable, elegant, and easy to use.

Evolution covers email, calendar, tasks, contacts, and reminders.

None of this works. Eight years ago this app was the best one on Linux, now none of it works. What is up with that. I can connect to one of my five mail accounts. Calendars are not working right but it's something with Google I think. Tasks don't work becuase Calendars don't work.
nice idea and bad dev
work on Ubuntu18. Nice GUI.

don't work with Gmail
other stuffs are good
Good looking UI and when you restore your data you dont need to reconfigure your emails.

I've been using Evolution professionally and exclusively since almost 6 years with gmail and it works (using gnome online accounts).
The only missing thing is the lack of enterprise directory integration for contacts resolution.
exceed expectation

On 11/15/2020, I attempted to replace Thunderbird with Evolution, but Google reported that this app did not provide a level of security they would trust by default.

Hard stop, de-installed the app, still looking for something to replace TBird (it stopped accessing my att.net account).

I have been using Evolution for many years now and generally find the app to be extremely good. However of recent I have had a couple of instances of the printing being broken (Both direct to printer and to PDF). This is the case now with the current version (3.38.1-1). As occasionally printing for me is a critical function, I find myself forced into using other email applications. For this reason I find myself unable to offer any better rating and unable to hand-on-hart recommend the current version to anyone.
summary: Great app, would be better if printing worked

description: Read the title...

I using Ubuntu Voyager 20.10 and like any other ubuntu Evolution came installed, I personally don't like this app and keeps running on the background wasting energy and space! what I don't understand is this since when did evolution-- server and evolution-data as the control over gnome-shell, gnome-desktop, gnome-extensions, gnome-tweak, gnome-dock, ubuntu-desktop and many more? if I want to delete evolution-server or data the system will crash, what a dumm idea! I have on my laptop Elementary OS and I can and did deleted all evolution packages and it only deleted what I wanted.
Thunderbird on the other hand can do more without hustle.

Every few years I take another look at Evolution hoping it will get the job done. It has never been quite enough.
Currently my deal breaker is the lack of subtasks.
summary: Still not ready for real world use

description: For my needs (mail, calendar, contacts, tasks) this apps outperforms Thunderbird, and it has better integration with the Ubuntu system.

EvoMail ver 3.38 is now getting much better.
It works flawlessly on Ubuntu 20.10 (Kernel 5.9). It can handle a lot of emails witthout any crash, CPU usage is also fairly less.
Header style is excellent.

The only thing is, when will skinning/ theme be available.....
This works great, better than thunderbird. Google calendar is hard to get working though.
It wouldn't sign into my Gmail account.
I want to use GMAIL. I don't know what an OAUTH2 SECRET is. WHY WON'T THIS WORK?
summary: Would not sign into my GMAIL

description: Now won't authenticate to gmail. What changed?  Enabled IMAP on gmail, entered appropriate email addresses and PW in Evolution, but still failing to authenticate then timeout.
summary: Was working fine until a couple of hours ago 3pm Feb 5 2021 but

description: Lacks almost every feature a good email client should have

I was looking for an Outlook alternative for Ubuntu with a nice GUI. And it found my Gmail account at startup (With third party auth provider) without any fuzz. Perfect ! 

Recommended. And I will donate now.
summary: Up and running in no time

description: received OAUTH2 SECRET error. uninstalled and installed Thunderbird.
Great! Has it all

Coming from MS Outlook application this wasn't too difficult of a transition. In my opinion this is way better than Thunderbird. The IWS add-on is a must, follow guides found on-line for set-up. I can see and edit calendars on Outlook Live accounts and Gmai. Down side it the app does loose connection to the server periodically however a close and relaunch seems to solve those events. Using Ubuntu 20.04.
summary: Works w/ Gmail, Outlook Live and older MSN

description: the resolution is of in both orientations for the pinephone. not recommended until it gets an update.
I was struggling with thunderbird and outlook integration before and then I heard about Evolution. This is gold, I like it!

After finally getting fed up of thunderbird and the crappy lightning calendar, I tried a lot of different email apps on both windows and linux, and I've always come back to Evolution. It does everything I need and works reliably. The calendar and address book are basically set and forget. Every once in a while I'll be tempted by an app thats says it's the next best thing in email and I'll give it a whirl and I've seen quite a few (Geary, mailspring, heck I've even tried claws ) but in the end there's always something they didn't do right (or at all), or some anoying "feature" they try try to push on users because they feel it's THE way to do email (I'm looking at you geary). And...invariably I find myself uninstalling them and continuing with Evolution. It's bomb proof!
I especially like the backup capabilities.

In my work I'm using Outlook (Company policy...) and I was searching something similar for my personal computer. And found - Evolution does it all! Very important part for me is calendar and that it would sync with my mail. And it does it perfectly (though took some time to find how to sync it in two ways - seems there is exchange plugin). 5 STARS!
summary: Best Mail and Calendar app I found in Linux world

description:
Ich mag den großen Funktionsumfang von Evolution sehr. Habe das Programm auf all meinen Linux Rechnern installiert.
In der aktuellen Version hat sich allerdings ein kleiner Bug eingeschlichen.
Immer wenn man von Kalender, Kontakte, etc. auf E-Mail zurückwechselt öffnet sich der Einrichtungsassistent. Das ist störend. Bitte beheben. Ansonsten Top Programm.

Für mich bisher die beste Lösung in Verbindung mit einem Google & Microsoft-Outlook Account. Kalender und E-Mail funktionieren ohne Probleme und ohne extra Einrichtung, wenn man vorher die Onlinekonten in Ubuntu eingerichtet hat.
summary: Funktioniert perfekt mit Google Kalender und Mail

description: Hat mittlerweile Thunderbird abgelöst! Evolution bittet alles, was ein E-Mail Programm können muss.
funktioniert perfekt. hat alles was man braucht.

Sieht etwas altbacken aus, ist aber bei weitem besser als Thunderbird.
Allein die Google Integration macht es aus. Das Design dürfte mal überarbeitet werden. Sieht sehr nach 95 Jahre aus.
funktioniert gut und ist sehr komplett

Klar das Design ist uralt und benötigt dringend mal eine Modernisierung.
Aber dafür glänzt das Programm mit optimaler Exchange-Einbindung und einem umfangreichen Kalender.
Alle Funktionen die Thunderbird schlicht nicht bietet oder erst per Addon nachgerüstet werden müssen, sind hier von Haus aus dabei.
summary: Besser als man auf den ersten Blick denkt

description: super Emailprogramm
sollte Standard werden in Ubuntu nicht immer Thunderbird danke

Termine sind einfach zu handhaben und es ist übersichtlich. Allerdings springt die Ansicht immer auf das zuletzt geänderte Datum einer Aufgabe. Mir wäre es lieber, wenn man auf der Polition bliebe, an der man zuvor war.

Ich kann mir keinen besseren E-Mail-Client als Evolution vorstellen. Kalender und Kontakte werden Tadellos synchronisiert.
Das Design kommt nicht mit der überfrachteten und unübersichtlichen Menüleiste á la M$ Office 2013+ daher, was ich sehr begrüße!
summary: Bester E-Mail-Client für Google und Exchange

description:
Hier hat die Vertraulichkeit höchsten Stellenwert. 
PGP/GnuPG und S/MIME funktionieren perfekt! 
Super!!
Ich bin restlos begeistert!

Es ist nur umständlich einzurichten obwohl viele Dinge vorhanden sind. Die persönliche Konfiguration ist vorgeschrieben. Ich möchte bestimmen wie es aussieht! Drucken funktioniert nicht, man kann keinen Drucker auswählen. Per PDF Druck wird etwas gemacht, aber man findet diese Dateien nirgends auf dem Computer. Ich habe keine Zeit ewig mich mit nicht funktionierenden Programmen zu beschäftigen.
für mich das beste Mailprogramm für Linux!
Evolution ist tatsächlich sehr gut, aber leider auch sehr langsam.

Wieder mal ein Programm das früher besser war. Mehr ist dazu nicht zu sagen. Es stürzt oft ab bevor es gestartet wird, dann kommt ein Timeout. Dagegen hilft nur ein Neustart der Maschine. Scheint sich daher auch leider um sehr schlechte Software zu handeln.
Sehr mächtig, aber auch teilweise langsam und buggy. Ich wechsel immer wieder zwischen Thunderbird und Evo hin und her.
summary: Gutes Programm, nutze es seit vielen Jahren, aber nicht perfekt

description: Eine andere Instanz von Evolution könnte nicht reagieren. Systemfehler: Zeitüberschreitung.    Kommt leider sehr oft vor. Fazit: kompletter Mist!

Problemlos einzurichten, auch mit Nicht-Allerwelts-Anbietern; ansprechend und übersichtlich gestaltet, individuell einstellbar. Funktioniert alles, anders als bei Apple-Mail, und selbst Thunderbird vorzuziehen.

Thunderbird mag vieleicht gut sein und seine Vorzüge haben, aber wenn es in Sachen E-Mail etwas besseres gibt dann ist das Evolution. Das Programm könnte mal einen neuen Anstrich gebrauchen, aber dafür glänzt es mit Bedienungsfreundligkeit und es hat alles was Man(n) für die Tägliche E-Mail bearbeitung braucht. Mein Fazit 5 x ***** +
summary: Für mich das " must have " in Sachen E-mail

description: Tut was es soll. Für mich #1 auf Linux
Alles was ich von einem Mail-Programm erwarte. Kalender, Kontakte und Aufgaben lassen sich super mit Nextcloud synchronisieren

Zumindest klingt der Name der Software nach fortschritt. Schade! Dieses Evolution Programm erinnert an Microsoft Mail aus den 1990-er Jahren.   Kann man nicht gebrauchen, wenn man unter Ubuntu Gnome ein Outlookkonto als Onlinekonto verbunden hat führt wohl kein weg dazu daß Evolution dieses verwendet, ich habe zumindest keinen entdecken können. Schlechte Software muß nicht teuer sein. Ich bleibe dann also bei Thunderbird und der Einrichtung von Hand wie vor 10 Jahren. Evolution ist das wohl nicht!
summary: Ubuntu Online Konten und Evolution sind wohl wie Feuer und Wasser

description: Ich wäre sehr vorsichtig hier, das es keine Updates erhält. Deswegen nutze ich wieder Thunderbird 78.
Unter Ubuntu, erst Onlinekonten einrichten, Outlook mit Exchange, und perfekte Verwaltung von Kalender, Kontakten und E-Mails, von Googel und Outlook genießen.

, besonders jetzt, wo ich dabei bin, meine komplette Infrastruktur auf Linux und Open Source Software umzustellen. Windows und andere Micro$oft -Produkte kommen mir nur noch auf die Hardware, wenn Kunden, Wert auf native (proprietäre) Dokumentformate legen oder wenn ich Visio verwende - was übrigens kein originäres Micro$oft-Produkt ist, sondern zugekauft wurde. Leider habe ich bisher keine adäquate OpenSource-Alternative finden können.

Im Übrigen verwende ich OpenSource-Software, weil ich eben gerade nicht so oft mit Feature-Updates belästigt werde, was ja auch für die Stabilität eines Produkts spricht. Und wenn ich Klicki-Bunti vom Neuesten haben will, muss das wirklich nicht in Zusammenhang mit E-Mail, Kalender und Aufgabenverwaltung sein.
summary: Ich bin mit Evolution vollkommen zufrieden,

description: Mein erster Versuch mit Evolution: Ich richte ein bestehendes IMAP-Konto ein, welches unter Thunderbird klaglos funktioniert. Evolution meldet nur, dass es die Ordnerliste einliest, und bricht dann mit der Fehlermeldung "Zeitüberschreitung" ab, ohne mich jemals nach einem Passwort gefragt zu haben.
summary: IMAP: Verlangt kein Passwort und bricht dann mit Fehlermeldung ab

description: Perfektes Mailprogramm!
ohne abstürze,einfache install,supi
Bevor unser Unternehmen MFA aktivierte, funktionierte Evolution mit Office 365 tadellos. Leider kann ich es nun nicht mehr verwenden und muss mit der Office 365 Web App leben.
summary: nativee MFA Unterstützung für Office 365 fehlt

description: Leider gibt es Probleme mit Webkit. Drucken geht nicht und bei einigen eMails fehlen Betreff und Absender, da sie nicht geladen werden können.
summary: Gutes Programm mit ein paar Macken

description: verbindet sich mit keinem meienr Emailkonten.....

Verwaltet zuverlässig meine 5 Mail Accounts.

Fedora 34 - Dell XPS 9305

Kein Drucken möglich. Behauptet felsenfest, es wäre kein Drucker installiert...
Nur noch Schrott! Eigentlich kein Stern!!

... die Synchronisation mit Google Contacts klappt nicht.

Fehlermeldung: "Ungültige Anfrageadresse oder -kopfzeile, oder nicht unterstützter Nicht-Standardparameter: Contacts API is being deprecated. Migrate to People API to retain programmatic access to Google Contacts. See https://developers.google.com/people/contacts-api-migration."

Wenn das Programm so wie in Linux Insider angepriesen funktionieren würde, könnte es vielleicht ganz gut sein.
Unser Linux Guru Herr Kanem Etem beschreibt es als Outlook Nachbildung.
Outlook hat aber immer bestens funktioniert. Ich bin enttäuscht.
summary: Kein Assistent nach der Installation. Damit Daumen runter

description:
Aus Versehen zuerst in der Flatpak-Version installiert und dabei Probleme wie auch beschrieben bekommen:

Hänger beim Abgleichen von IMAP-Konten, kein Zugriff auf Dateifreigaben (ist allgemein Flatpak geschuldet), Probleme bei der Kontoeinrichtung.

Aus dem Repository der Distri jedoch keinerlei Probleme.
summary: Empfehlenswertes Mailprogramm mit guter Termin- und Aufgabenverwaltung

description: Leider bin ich beruflich auf einen Exchange-Server angewiesen. Evolution machts auch auf Linux möglich.
summary: Gutes E-Mail Programm für Exchange / Outlook-Ersatz

description: Hervorragende Mail App
Sehr gutes E-Programm.

Ein wirklich komplettes, einfach zu bedienendes Programm.
Besten Dank!

War lange Zeit mein Favorit. Seit Version 38.x kein Drucken mehr möglich. Im Internet mehren sich diese Missstände. E-Mail Client in Linux - ein Jammertal!
Nur noch Schrott!

El hecho de estar sincronizado con Gnome Online Accounts es un plus, quizás no decisivo. A pesar de su interfaz un tanto descuidada, no tengo necesidad de instalar Thunderbird en el caso de Debian (que viene con Evolution de serie).
Me parece muy lento y poco amigable, tarda mucho en cerrar...
al parecer no la actualizan, de todas maneras me había funcionado muy binen.. gracias
summary: dejo de funcionar con los correos gmail

description: Aunque promete mucho, la verdad es que tiene continuos problemas con las conexiones además de ser lento como ninguno. Las pocas veces que me he animado a darle "otra oportunidad" al final lo he eliminado antes de 48 horas. Seguiré con Thunderbird, infinitamente superior.

Lo uso desde hace muchos años.
Un cliente de correo estable completo y compatible.
Ideal para un desktop GNOME.
De los diferentes gestores de información, correo y calendario es de lo mejorcito. Sin complicaciones.
Lo único es que todavía no recibe una actualización desde hace años, pero deberías tenerlo.

es imposible configurar la cuenta imap de gmail. Te obliga a usar Oauth2
y no encuentro la forma de instalar otra vesión.
Estoy en Debian Buster... No sé porqué la gente dice que no funciona... a mi me funciona perfectamente y me ahorra unos minutos en que no tenga que abrir el Firefox y el correo...
Funciona perfectamente con Google sin embargo con Office365 (EWS) es molesto trabajar, frecuentemente aparecen mensajes de error de conexión a la cuenta y para traer la información es muy lento.

Lo puse la vista previa en vertical porque siento que se ve mejor si lo quieren poner así se vas a:
Menu "Ver" -----> Vista Previa -----> Vista Vertical

description:
Mis correos electrónicos se basan casi al 100% en Gmail, y no funcionan con este cliente. Cada vez que ingreso me vuelve a pedir las credenciales. 

Mailspring es mucho más bonito y organizado (al menos sí dan ganas de leer tus correos), pero no funciona el Calendario y no tiene opción a otras cosas como Tareas. 

Evolution sí tiene esas cosas, pero no se lleva bien con Gmail. En Thunderbird sí funciona todo, pero siento que hay que tener cerebro de físico nuclear para no perderse entre tantísimas opciones y paneles, y además es súper duro para cambiar la apariencia por algo más amigable.

Seguiré buscando un cliente de correos electrónicos ideal. Hasta hoy (01/06/2021) no encuentro, pero admito que soy nuevo en Linux.
De lo mejorcito. Completo y funcional. Se integra perfectamente con Gnome y con KDE.
summary: Lector de correo, calendarios, agenda, etc

description: que es bueno, pero le faltan algo mas de funcionalidades, como conexión con protocolos IRC Y XMMP
summary: está muy bien, pero le falta algo de funcionalidad

description: Mail, contactos y calendario bien integrado

La vengo usando desde hace mas de 5 años. Está muy bien pensada y lograda. Es muy rápida en equipos básicos con SSD. La uso con 6 cuentas cada una con sus calendarios y contactos (gmail, yahoo, aol y otras). 
Dentro de lo que es libre es muy completo, ocupa su lugar y sigan estando ahí. Tiene un par competidores que están a la altura (Thunderbird y MS Outlook Desktop), esto es como estar cabeza a cabeza siempre. Funciona bien, felicitaciones.

Es la mejor aplicación cliente de correo que existe. elegante y funcional, lo que sí necesita es actualizar su interfaz y hacerla más flexible y cercano a GTK 4. También sería bueno modularizar sus componentes, ya que la versión actual de calendario de gnome me resulta mejor (en términos visuales) que la versión de evolution. Creo que el futuro de Evolution es fragmentarse y perfeccionarse en los correos exclusivamente. Felicitaciones al equipo de desarrolladores!!

L'interface est beaucoup trop encombrée. L'agenda intégré est redondant sur l'appli Agenda. Le tout ressemble à Outlook 2003, or chacun sait à quel point ce logiciel est vieillot.
Refonte impérative, ça ressemble même pas à du Gtk3
Indispensable pour gérer des cas qui ne peuvent pas être gérés correctement par Agenda ou Contacts. L'interface est un peu lourde, mais toutes les fonctionnalités sont là.
L'appli fait le boulot, mais elle est assez lourde. Cela manque de fluidité.

Ce que j'aime:

- complet (agenda + messagerie, ...) 
- raccourcis claviers pour passer de la boite mail à l'agenda ou encore du mois au jour, etc. 
- interface claire et personnalisable.
Tout est dans le titre, l'interface nécessite une sérieuse refonte !
Fait très bien sont travail.
Elle a gagné en réactivité depuis la version 3.32. Superbement intégrée à Gnome, elle permet de synchroniser facilement ses calendriers et ses contacts via les comptes en ligne.
Fait le travail , simple et efficace
Gère très bien les signatures et les polices (ce qui manque à Thunderbird). Je l'utilise pour les emails PRO.

Plus qu'un client mail, permet de gérer agendas, tâches, notes... Dommage que les règles de tri des mails ne soient pas synchronisées vers le serveur EWS. Mériterait peut être un rajeunissement de son interface.
summary: Équivalent d'outlook pour le bureau Gnome

description:
Une application complète pour gérer les mails, les rendez-vous, les activités... Tout est centralisé ici. Bien entendu, ces avantages se paient aussi en terme de lourdeur et parfois, il faut bien le dire, dans l'ergonomie pas toujours évidente à prendre en mai. 
Il n'en reste pas moins vrai qu'il vaut largement son concurrent Thunderbird, notamment grâce aux fonctions de synchronisation et à son adaptation dans Gnome shell.
L'interface est old. Il faut la moderniser, sinon en terme de fonctionnalités, il est top !
summary: Complet mais nécessite une refonte de l'interface

description: Jusqu'à présent j'utilisais Thunderbird mais celui-ci ne peut pas gérer nativement une boite Exchange sans l'ajout d'un plugin payant. Evolution permet de remédier à ce problème et prend cette fonctionnalité en charge nativement et reprend l'ensemble des fonctionnalités concernant l'agenda, les contacts, etc.

Une application simple, claire, précise, un truc comme on n'en fait plus, sans fioriture et qui fonctionne en faisant ce qu'on lui demande sans chercher midi à 14h.

L'interface graphique est à l'avenant, pas de bling bling.

Une application reposante.

En soit, c'est hyper complet, agenda, notes, mails, et tout et tout... Mais l'appli est limite en terme de "design", c'est un poil lourd en RAM, bref... je suis passé à Geary (avec d'autres soucis...)
Ça manque de modernité...
avec moi ça na pas fonctionner voila pourquoi 2 étoiles. )':
rien a dire tous fonction bien , c'est vrai un petit coup de jeune sa serait un plus ,sinon tant que ce fait sont boulot .

Très bon logiciel de mail, mais combien de temps allons-nous trainer ces interfaces du siècle dernier ? Une interface peut très bien être simple ET belle, sans être bling bling, et ça fait partie intégrante de l'ergonomie.

Ce client mail/PIM reste encore aujourd'hui le meilleur compromis entre fonctionnalités et intégration au système.
Même si je suis séduit par l'interface des applications GNOME modernes (Geary, gnome-calendar, gnome-todo, etc...) je dois bien reconnaître que niveau fonctionnalité on est loin du compte.
Evolution reste le seul client en GTK3 à gérer nativement l'encryption des mails, la synchronisation Exchange, les listes de tâches en CalDAV, les tâches récurrentes, l'affichage complet Tâches + Memo + Agenda, et j'en oublie.
Alors certes l'interface est un peu datée dans ses paradigmes, cependant je ne pense pas non plus qu'elle soit grossière. Je souhaiterais juste à la limite une modernisation de l'interface de l'agenda pour quelque chose de plus clair.
summary: Le meilleur compromis à l'heure actuelle

description: To bad, because it doesn't work in French language !!
Voilà tout est dans le titre ! ;-)
summary: Complet avec interface se rapprochant de Outlook !

description: très bien
Malheureusement la version sur Ubuntu 20.04.1 ne fonctionne pas alors que celle sur Ubuntu 18.04 est parfaite
mais l'impression du courrier marche pas de mon coté

Après 1 an et demi d'usage, je suis passé à Thunderbird. Pourquoi? 
- Une interface plus propre,
- une possibilité d'archiver sur le PC les mails
- à la différence d'Evolution, pas besoin de demander à synchroniser les boites mails à chaque fois pour que les messages envoyés partent réellement (je précise ça ne marchait pas du tout peu importe le temps configuré ou le temps laissé au logiciel, c'est pour moi particulièrement rédhibitoire) 
- les possibilités de paramétrage sont plus nombreuses
Impossible d'imprimer un courriel avec cette application., même en format PDF. Pourtant, cela devrait être une fonctionnalité essentielle.
Parfait pour transférer sa messagerie microsoft de windows vers linux
Impossible d'ajouter mon compte Outlook
when is the french version ?

Fonctionnel.
Bien intégré à GNOME.
Aucune fonctionnalité manquante.
1 Gigabyte for a mail app ???

Bonne application ! Il est juste dommage que ni le thème ni la langue se soient respectés... Sans doute à cause des flatpaks... Je suis sous Fedora 32 en Français avec le thème yaru (de ubuntu), et les boutons de fenêtre à gauche.

Le top, beaucoup plus léger que Thunderbird, offre les mêmes fonctionnalités et même plus puisque de base ne nécessite aucun plugin pour la gestion complète des comptes cloud, éditeur de signature intégré, etc ...

Fonctionne mieux que Thunderbird que j'ai abandonné pour Evolution
Connecté correctement sur mon serveur nextCloud
tout va bien mis à part le bouton maillto de Firefox qui ne fonctionne pas

description: Its working with Microsoft Exchange
Почта, а что еще должно быть в почтовом клиенте
С EWS работает без проблем
Отличная поддержка google-сервисов: gmail, tasks, контактной книги, календаря. Жаль нет заметок google keep
Работает быстро настраивается ни чего лишнего.
Поддерживает MS Exchange ! Это главное!
Это ж почтовая программа. Не понятно зачем здесь планировщик, календарь, заметки и т.д. Бред.
Пользуюсь им постоянно, очень удобный и легковестный.
супер. ews работает. немного красоты надо добавить

Опробовал разные клиенты под Ubuntu, остановился на этом. Не понимаю, почему Thunderbird идет по учолчанию. Мне кажется Эволюшен лаконичней и в то же время содржит и календарь и планирощик и контакты. После Аутлука и Бата ни каких проблем. Почту gmail берет сразу из сетевой учетной записи в Убунту, если она заведена. Для оповещений есть гномовское расширение.
Самый лучший клиент почты как и всегда.

Без проблем работает с Microsoft Exchange, пожалуй единственный который так работает. Для Thunderbird нужны платные плагины, остальные просто не подключаются. Легко цепляет и автоматически учетки из сетевых учетных записей. Интерфейс конечно не очень, не хватает красоты.
otlichnaya proga google servisi rabotaet prosto otlichno
Отлично, все заявленные функции работают. С Exchange работает.

Перешёл с тяжёлого и тормознутого Thunderbird. Evolution работает быстрее, функционал не хуже Thunderbird. Единственное, это не хватает расширений. Но и без этого приложение работает прекрасно. Пользуюсь больше года.
